H0.text: Catching more than 20 fish in the same location would most likely disprove the students’ claim that the morning was the best time to fish, because they caught only 20 fish in the morning compared with 5 fish the afternoon before.

H1.text: Catching more than 20 fish in another location would most likely disprove the claim that the morning was the best time to fish, since two students caught 20 fish that morning compared to only 5 fish the afternoon before.

H2.text: Catching more than 20 fish the next afternoon would most likely disprove the students' claim that morning was the best time to fish, since they caught 20 fish in the morning and only 5 in the afternoon.

H3.text: Catching more than 20 fish the next morning would most likely disprove the students’ claim that the morning is the best time to fish, because they caught 20 fish in the morning and only 5 in the afternoon.

A4.text: weather conditions can alter the fish's foraging behavior

A5.text: Fishing seasons are enforced (usually by water police) to maintain ecological balance and to protect species of fish during their spawning period during which they are easier to catch and more physiologically vulnerable.
